text: {| class="infobox" style="width: 25em; text-align: left; font-size: 90%; vertical-align: middle;" |+ List of awards and nominations received by Eat Bulaga! |- | colspan="3" style="text-align:center;" |200px |- | style="text-align:center;" colspan="3"| ;Total number of wins and nominations |- style="background:#ddf;" | | |- | | |- style="background:#d9e8ff;" | colspan="3" style="font-size: smaller; text-align:center;" | References |} Eat Bulaga! is a Filipino variety television program created and produced by Television and Production Exponents, Inc. The show is broadcast on GMA Network. As the country's longest running noontime show, it has been nominated and won a variety of different awards, including the Asian Television Awards, PMPC Star Awards for Television, Box Office Entertainment Awards, and Golden Screen TV Awards. ==Aliw Awards== The Aliw Awards is an awards ceremony organized by the Aliw Awards Foundation, Inc. that gives recognition to entertainers who perform live in the Philippines and abroad. The SexBomb Girls and EB Babes have been nominated as the Best Modern Dance Company in 2007 and 2008. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row"|2007 | Best Dance Company (Modern) | SexBomb Girls | | style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row" rowspan="2"|2008 | Best Dance Company (Modern) | SexBomb Girls | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2"| |- | Best Dance Company (Modern) | EB Babes | |- !scope="row" rowspan="2"|2015 | Best Stand-Up Comedian | Jose Manalo | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2"| |- | Best Stand-Up Comedian | Wally Bayola | |- !scope="row" rowspan="3"|2016 | Best Stand-Up Comedian | Jose Manalo | | style="text- align:center;"| |- | Best Stand-Up Comedian | Wally Bayola | | style="text- align:center;" rowspan="2"| |- | Best Female Host | Patricia Tumulak | |} ==Anak TV Seal Awards== The Anak TV Seal Awards are awarded annually to honor wholesome and family-friendly television shows and personalities who exemplify good values to children. Eat Bulaga! has been included for three consecutive years as one of the most well-liked television program and some of its hosts have also been admired as child-friendly television personalities. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row" rowspan="2"|2009 | Most Admired Male TV Personality | Vic Sotto | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2"| |- | Most Admired Male TV Personality | Ryan Agoncillo | |- !scope="row"|2010 | Most Admired Male TV Personality | Ryan Agoncillo | | style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row" rowspan="3"|2011 | Most Well-Liked TV Program | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text- align:center;" rowspan="3"| |- | Most Admired Male TV Personality | Vic Sotto | |- | Most Admired Male TV Personality | Ryan Agoncillo | |- !scope="row" rowspan="3"|2012 | Most Well-Liked TV Program | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text- align:center;" rowspan="3"| |- | Most Admired Male TV Personality | Vic Sotto | |- | Most Admired Male TV Personality | Ryan Agoncillo | |- !scope="row" rowspan="3"|2013 | Most Well-Liked TV Program | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text- align:center;" rowspan="3"| |- | Most Admired Male TV Personality | Vic Sotto | |- | Most Admired Male TV Personality | Ryan Agoncillo | |- !scope="row"|2014 | Anak TV Makabata Star Awardee | Vic Sotto | | style="text- align:center;"| |- !scope="row" rowspan="3"| 2015 | Anak TV Makabata Star Awardee | Vic Sotto | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="3"| |- | Anak TV Makabata Star Awardee | Alden Richards | |- | Anak TV Makabata Star Awardee | Maine Mendoza | |- |} ==Asian Television Awards== The Asian Television Awards is an annual awards ceremony that recognizes programming, performance, and production excellence in the Asian television industry. Eat Bulaga! won once for the special episode of its 25th anniversary celebration, becoming the first award won by the show from an international award-giving body. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row"| 2005 | Best Entertainment (One-Off/Annual) | Eat Bulaga! Silver Special | | style="text-align:center;"| |- |} ==Box Office Entertainment Awards== The Box Office Entertainment Awards is an annual awards ceremony organized by the Guillermo Mendoza Memorial Scholarship Foundation, Inc. that honors stars and performers simply for their popularity and commercial success in the Philippine entertainment industry. In 2007, Eat Bulaga!s former mainstay SexBomb Dancers were elevated to the Hall of Fame due to their five consecutive wins as the Most Popular Dance Group. In addition to multiple awards, Eat Bulaga! also received a special citation for its special episode, "AlDub: Sa Tamang Panahon," for gaining the highest record rating of a noontime show of all time. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row"| 2002 | Most Popular Dance Group | SexBomb Dancers | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="5"| |- !scope="row"| 2003 | Most Popular Dance Group | SexBomb Dancers | |- !scope="row"| 2004 | Most Popular Dance Group | SexBomb Dancers | |- !scope="row"| 2005 | Most Popular Dance Group | SexBomb Dancers | |- !scope="row"| 2006 | Most Popular Dance Group | SexBomb Dancers | |- !scope="row" rowspan="2"| 2007 | Hall of Fame | SexBomb Dancers | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2"| |- | Most Popular Dance Group | EB Babes | |- !scope="row"| 2008 | Most Popular Dance Group | EB Babes | | style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row"| 2009 | Most Popular Dance Group | EB Babes | | style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row" rowspan="2"| 2012 | Most Popular TV Program - Musical Variety/Noontime & Primetime | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2"| |- | Bert Marcelo Lifetime Achievement Award | Jose Manalo and Wally Bayola | |- !scope="row"| 2013 | Most Popular TV Program - Musical Variety/Noontime & Primetime | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row"| 2014 | Most Popular TV Program - Musical Variety/Noontime & Primetime | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row" rowspan="2"| 2015 | Most Popular TV Program - Musical Variety/Noontime & Primetime | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2"| |- | Corazon Samaniego Lifetime Achievement Award | Vic Sotto | |- !scope="row" rowspan="5"| 2016 | Most Popular TV Program - Musical Variety/Noontime & Primetime | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="5"| |- | Breakthrough Male Star of Philippine Movies and TV | Alden Richards | |- | Breakthrough Female Star of Philippine Movies and TV | Maine Mendoza | |- | Bert Marcelo Lifetime Achievement Award | Jose Manalo, Wally Bayola, and Paolo Ballesteros | |- | Highest Record Rating of a Noontime Show of All Time (Local & Global) | AlDub: Sa Tamang Panahon | |- !scope="row" rowspan="2"| 2017 | Most Promising Recording/Performing Group | That's My Bae | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2"| |- | Global Achievement by a Filipino Artist | Paolo Ballesteros | |- |} ==Catholic Social Media Awards== The Catholic Social Media Awards are given by church-based organizations Youth Pinoy and Areopagus Communications during the annual Catholic Social Media Summit to recognize personalities and groups in the entertainment industry who are promoting Christian values. In 2015, the production company and the stars behind Kalyeserye became the first recipients of the Catholic Social Media Awards for spreading traditional virtues and good values through the segment. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row" rowspan="5"| 2015 | Catholic Social Media Achievement Award | TAPE, Inc. | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="5"| |- | Catholic Social Media Achievement Award | Alden Richards | |- | Catholic Social Media Achievement Award | Maine Mendoza | |- | Catholic Social Media Achievement Award | AlDub Nation | |- | Catholic Social Media Inspirational Award | Wally Bayola | |} ==Eastwood City Walk of Fame== The Eastwood City Walk of Fame is a sidewalk along Eastwood City, Quezon City that serves as a Philippine entertainment hall of fame. It is embedded with hundreds of brass star plaques featuring the names of celebrities for their popularity and contributions to the entertainment industry. Several hosts of the show have been inducted into the Walk of Fame. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- ! rowspan="2" scope="row" | 2009 | Eastwood City Walk of Fame Star | Francis Magalona | | rowspan="2" style="text-align:center;" | |- |Eastwood City Walk of Fame Star |Michael V. | |- !scope="row" rowspan="3"| 2010 | Eastwood City Walk of Fame Star | Tito Sotto | | style="text- align:center;" rowspan="3"| |- | Eastwood City Walk of Fame Star | Vic Sotto | |- | Eastwood City Walk of Fame Star | Joey de Leon | |- |2011 |Eastwood City Walk of Fame Star |Iza Calzado | ! |- !scope="row"| 2014 | Eastwood City Walk of Fame Star | Allan K. | | style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row" rowspan="5"| 2015 | Eastwood City Walk of Fame Star | Alden Richards | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="5"| |- | Eastwood City Walk of Fame Star | Maine Mendoza | |- | Eastwood City Walk of Fame Star | Jose Manalo | |- | Eastwood City Walk of Fame Star | Wally Bayola | |- | Eastwood City Walk of Fame Star | Paolo Ballesteros | |} ==EdukCircle Awards== The award-giving body of the EdukCircle Awards aims to recognize exemplary performances of media practitioners and entertainment celebrities as voted by participating universities across the Philippines. Eat Bulaga!s AlDub won two awards. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row"| 2015 | Most Popular Breakout Loveteam | Alden Richards and Maine Mendoza | | style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row"| 2016 | Special Recognition for Phenomenal Act | Alden Richards and Maine Mendoza | | style="text-align:center;"| |} == Face of Advertising and Marketing Excellence (FAME) Awards == The Face of Advertising and Marketing Excellence (FAME) Awards is an awards ceremony presented by the Junior Marketing Association of the De La Salle University – Dasmariñas in order to recognize and honor individuals who have made a mark a breakthrough in the marketing, promotion, and advertising industry in the previous year. Eat Bulaga! child wonders Ryzza Mae Dizon and Sebastian Benedict each won once. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row"| 2016 | Best Child Endorser | Ryzza Mae Dizon | |style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row"| 2017 | Best Child Endorser | Sebastian Benedict | |style="text- align:center;"| |- |} ==FAMAS Awards== The FAMAS Awards are the annual honors given by the Filipino Academy of Movie Arts and Sciences to recognize excellence in cinematic achievements. In 2015, the legendary trio of Tito Sotto, Vic Sotto, and Joey de Leon were honored with the FAMAS Lifetime Achievement Award for their contributions to Philippine cinema. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row"| 2015 | FAMAS Lifetime Achievement Award | Tito Sotto, Vic Sotto, and Joey de Leon | | style="text-align:center;"| |- |} ==Filipino Franchise Show== Launched by the Association of Filipino Franchisers, Inc., the Filipino Franchise Show is a trade fair that promotes excellence and growth in franchising by showcasing the potential of homegrown Filipino businesses. Antonio P. Tuviera, the producer of Eat Bulaga!, was honored for being the first to have successfully franchised a Filipino television show, in this case, the long-running noontime show Eat Bulaga! to Indonesia. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row"| 2012 | Galing ng Pinoy Excellence Award | Antonio P. Tuviera | | style="text- align:center;"| |- |} ==Gawad Tanglaw Awards== The Gawad Tanglaw Awards is an academe-based award giving body that honors outstanding works and personalities in film, television, radio, print, and theater arts that contribute to the development of Philippine arts as a whole. In addition to the awards received by some of its hosts, Eat Bulaga! was honored with a Lifetime Achievement Award in 2011 for its more than three decades of bringing happiness to the Filipino people. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row"| 2011 | Lifetime Achievement Award | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row"| 2014 | Natatanging BATA (Bibo, Aktibo, at Talentadong Anak) ng Sining Award | Ryzza Mae Dizon | | style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row"| 2015 | Best Single Performance by an Actor | Keempee de Leon | | style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row" rowspan="2"| 2016 | Natatanging Tanglaw ng Kabataan sa Sining ng Telebisyon | Alden Richards and Maine Mendoza | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2"| |- | Natatanging Gawad Tanglaw sa Sining ng Telebisyon | Antonio P. Tuviera | |} ==GEMS Hiyas ng Sining Awards== The GEMS Hiyas ng Sining Awards is an academe-based awards ceremony organized by the Guild of Educators, Mentors, and Students (GEMS) that honors outstanding works and personalities in print, radio, film, theatre, and television. Eat Bulaga! won once. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row"| 2017 | Best TV Program | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;"| |} ==Gintong Kabataan Awards== The Gintong Kabataan Awards is an event presented by the provincial government of Bulacan that aims to recognize outstanding youth from their province who have excelled in their respective fields and have inspired others to live to their fullest potential. Eat Bulaga! host and Bulacan native Maine Mendoza was a 2015 awardee. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row"| 2015 | Gintong Kabataan sa Larangan ng Sining at Kultura | Maine Mendoza | | style="text-align:center;"| |} ==Global Pinoy Awards== The Global Pinoy Awards is an event hosted by MEGA Magazine to honor homegrown talents whose crafts have defied the odds to succeed in the global stage and to ultimately become icons of Philippine culture. Eat Bulaga! creative head Jenny Ferre was honored for her contributions to the success of the phenomenal loveteam AlDub and the segment Kalyeserye. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row"| 2016 | Global Pinoy Awardee | Jenny Ferre | | style="text-align:center;"| |} ==Golden Screen TV Awards== The Golden Screen TV Awards is given annually by the Entertainment Press Society, Inc. to acknowledge the outstanding programs and personalities from different television networks in the country. The show and its hosts have been honored numerous times. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- | rowspan="2" |2004 |Outstanding Musical/Variety Program |Eat Bulaga! | | |- |Helen Vela Lifetime Achievement Award |Joey de Leon | | |- | rowspan="5" |2005 |Outstanding Male Host in a Musical or Variety Program |Joey de Leon | | |- |Outstanding Male Host in a Musical or Variety Program |Vic Sotto | | |- |Outstanding Female Host in a Musical or Variety Program |Toni Rose Gayda | | |- |Outstanding Female Host in a Musical or Variety Program |Pia Guanio | | |- |Special Citation as Longest-running Noontime Show on Philippine TV |Eat Bulaga! | | |- !scope="row" rowspan="6"|2011 | Outstanding Variety Program | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text- align:center;" rowspan="2"| |- | Outstanding Male Host in a Musical or Variety Program | Vic Sotto | |- | Outstanding Male Host in a Musical or Variety Program | Tito Sotto | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2"| |- | Outstanding Male Host in a Musical or Variety Program | Joey de Leon | |- | Outstanding Female Host in a Musical or Variety Program | Julia Clarete | | style="text-align:center;"| |- | Outstanding Female Host in a Musical or Variety Program | Pia Guanio | | style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row" rowspan="4"|2013 | Outstanding Variety Program | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text- align:center;" rowspan="2"| |- | Outstanding Male Host in a Musical or Variety Program | Ryan Agoncillo | |- | Outstanding Male Host in a Musical or Variety Program | Vic Sotto | | style="text-align:center;"| |- | Outstanding Female Host in a Musical or Variety Program | Julia Clarete | | style="text- align:center;"| |- !scope="row" rowspan="5"|2014 | Outstanding Variety Program | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2"| |- | rowspan="2" | Outstanding Male Host in a Musical or Variety Program | rowspan="2" | Allan K.Ryan Agoncillo | |- | | rowspan="2" | |- | Outstanding Female Host in a Musical or Program | Julia ClaretePia Guanio | |- | Special Citation as the Youngest TV Host | Ryzza Mae Dizon | | |- !scope="row" rowspan="5"|2015 | Outstanding Variety Program | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2"| |- | Outstanding Female Host for a Musical or Variety Program | Julia Clarete | |- | Outstanding Female Host for a Musical or Variety Program | Pia Guanio | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="3"| |- | Outstanding Male Host for a Musical or Variety Program | Allan K. | |- | Outstanding Male Host for a Musical or Variety Program | Ryan Agoncillo | |} ==Illumine== Illumine is an annual innovation awards ceremony presented by Global City Innovative College to recognize outstanding and innovative personalities and programs on Philippine television. The show and its hosts were hailed as most innovative in their respective categories. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row" rowspan="4"| 2015 | Most Innovative TV Noontime Show | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="4"| |- | Most Innovative TV Child Star | Ryzza Mae Dizon | |- | Most Innovative TV Comedian | Wally Bayola | |- | Most Innovative TV Loveteam | Alden Richards and Maine Mendoza | |- !scope="row"| 2018 | Most Innovative TV Personality | Paolo Ballesteros | | style="text-align:center| |} ==Inding-Indie Short Film Festival Awards== The Inding Indie Short Film Festival aims to support independent filmmakers and independent artists who are passionate about the media arts. Its awards ceremony recognizes films, television programs, and personalities for their noteworthy contributions to the media and entertainment industry. In 2015, Eat Bulaga! was hailed as the Best TV Show. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row"| 2015 | Best TV Show | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;" | |- !scope="row"| 2016 | Pinakahuwarang Komedyante ng Taon | Jose Manalo | | style="text-align:center;" | |} ==Kagitingan Awards for Television== Established in 2013, the Kagitingan Awards for Television are awarded annually by the Bataan Peninsula State University to recognize ten television programs from any kind of genre and ten television personalities who depicted a sense of valor in their respective shows. The recognition is based on the importance or values of heroism in its different faces. After being included five consecutive times, Eat Bulaga! was finally inducted into the Hall of Fame in 2017. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row"| 2013 | Pinakamagiting na Programang Pantelebisyon | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row"| 2014 | Pinakamagiting na Programang Pantelebisyon | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row"| 2015 | Pinakamagiting na Programang Pantelebisyon | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row" rowspan="2"| 2016 | Pinakamagiting na Programang Pantelebisyon | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text- align:center;" rowspan="2"| |- | Pinakamagiting na Personalidad na Pantelebisyon | Vic Sotto | |- !scope="row" rowspan="3"| 2017 | Pinakamagiting na Entertainment Program | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="3"| |- | Pinakamagiting na Personalidad ng Entertainment Program | Jose Manalo | |- | Hall of Fame |Eat Bulaga! | |- |} ==Mabini Media Awards== The Mabini Media Awards is presented by the Polytechnic University of the Philippines to acknowledge noteworthy programs, personalities, and advocacies of the television and radio industry, advertising, and new media. Eat Bulaga! won once. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row"| 2014 | Best Television Variety Program | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text- align:center;" rowspan="2"| |- !scope="row"| 2016 | Best Television Variety Program | Eat Bulaga! | |} ==Nickelodeon Kids' Choice Awards== The Nickelodeon Kids' Choice Awards is an annual international awards show that honors the year's biggest television, movie, and music stars, as voted by Nickelodeon viewers. Eat Bulaga! host Maine Mendoza emerged victorious as she was named Favorite Pinoy Personality in 2016. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row"| 2016 | Favorite Pinoy Personality | Maine Mendoza | | style="text-align:center;"| |- |} ==Northwest Samar State University Students' Choice Awards for Radio and Television== The Northwest Samar State University Students' Choice Awards for Radio and Television is an annual event that grants awards to programs and personalities that have great contributions in the field of broadcasting and entertainment. After winning five consecutive years in the same category, both Eat Bulaga! and its host Vic Sotto were inducted in 2015 to the Circle of Excellence, which is the academe's specific term for its hall of fame. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row" rowspan="2"| 2010 | Best Noontime Variety Show | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="4"| |- | Best Noontime Variety Show Host | Vic Sotto | |- !scope="row" rowspan="2"| 2011 | Best Noontime Variety Show | Eat Bulaga! | |- | Best Noontime Variety Show Host | Vic Sotto | |- !scope="row" rowspan="2"| 2012 | Best Noontime Variety Show | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2"| |- | Best Noontime Variety Show Host | Vic Sotto | |- !scope="row" rowspan="2"| 2013 | Best Noontime Variety Show | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="4"| |- | Best Noontime Variety Show Host | Vic Sotto | |- !scope="row" rowspan="2"| 2014 | Best Noontime Variety Show | Eat Bulaga! | |- | Best Noontime Variety Show Host | Vic Sotto | |- !scope="row" rowspan="2"| 2015 | Circle of Excellence Award | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2"| |- | Circle of Excellence Award | Vic Sotto | |- !scope="row" rowspan="4"| 2016 | Best Noontime Variety Show | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="4"| |- | Best Female Child Star | Ryzza Mae Dizon | |- | Most Effective Use of Social Media | Eat Bulaga! | |- | Social Media Phenomenon | Alden Richards and Maine Mendoza | |} ==OFW Gawad Parangal== The OFW Gawad Parangal is an award given to pay tribute to individuals, groups, and organizations who unselfishly share their time, skills, and resources for the welfare of overseas Filipinos. It is awarded by KAKAMMPI, Inc., a community-based organization of Overseas Filipino Workers. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row" rowspan="3"| 2015 | Outstanding Actor and Comedian | Jose Manalo | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="3"| |- | Favorite Actor and Comedian | Wally Bayola | |- | Most Popular Loveteam | Alden Richards and Maine Mendoza | |} ==Paragala Central Luzon Media Awards == The Paragala Central Luzon Media Awards is an awards ceremony presented by the Holy Angel University to recognize Central Luzon's choices of the best organizations, personalities, and programs on both local and national television. Eat Bulaga! won twice. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row"| 2016 | Best Noontime Show | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row"| 2017 | Best Noontime Show | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text- align:center;"| |} ==Party Pilipinas Most Liked Awards== The Party Pilipinas Most Liked Awards was an awards ceremony presented by the now-defunct Sunday musical variety show Party Pilipinas that aims to recognize the most liked Kapuso artists through online and text voting. Eat Bulaga! child wonder Ryzza Mae Dizon received an award once. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row"| 2012 | Most Liked New Artist | Ryzza Mae Dizon | | style="text-align:center;"| |} ==People's Choice Awards== The People's Choice Awards is presented by the People Asia Magazine to various individuals from all walks of life who inspire, encourage, and make a difference in the lives of others. After being featured on the cover of the magazine, Eat Bulaga!s AlDub were then chosen as People of the Year for becoming a global social phenomenon. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row" rowspan="2"| 2016 | People of the Year | Alden Richards | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2"| |- | People of the Year | Maine Mendoza | |- !scope="row"| 2017 | People of the Year | Antonio P. Tuviera | | style="text-align:center;"| |} ==PEP List Awards== The PEP List is presented by the Philippine Entertainment Portal to honor showbiz personalities, television shows, and movies that made a great impact in the year. The list is divided into two categories: Editors' Choice and PEPsters' Choice. The Editors' Choice subcategories will be chosen by the editors and staff of PEP, while the PEPsters' Choice subcategories will be decided upon by PEP users through an online poll. In addition to numerous awards received by its hosts, Eat Bulaga! emerged as the daytime TV show of 2014. ===Editors' Choice=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row" rowspan="3"| 2014 | TV Show of the Year (Daytime) | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="3"| |- | Male TV Star of the Year | Vic Sotto | |- | Female Child Star of the Year | Ryzza Mae Dizon | |- !scope="row" rowspan="2"| 2015 | Variety/Talk Show of the Year | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2"| |- | Male TV Star of the Year | Vic Sotto | |- !scope="row" rowspan="10"| 2016 | Variety/Game Show of the Year | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;"| |- | Male TV Star of the Year | Vic Sotto | | style="text-align:center;"| |- | Male TV Star of the Year | Alden Richards | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="3"| |- | Female TV Star of the Year | Maine Mendoza | |- | Female Breakout Star of the Year | Maine Mendoza | |- | Male Breakout Star of the Year | Wally Bayola | | style="text- align:center;" rowspan="3"| |- | Female Comedy Star of the Year | Maine Mendoza | |- | Male Comedy Star of the Year | Jose Manalo | |- | Male Comedy Star of the Year | Wally Bayola | | style="text-align:center;"| |- | Male Comedy Star of the Year | Paolo Ballesteros | | style="text-align:center;"| |} ===PEPsters' Choice=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row" rowspan="3"| 2014 | Male TV Star of the Year | Vic Sotto | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="3"| |- | Female Child Star of the Year | Ryzza Mae Dizon | |- | Male Showbiz Treasure of the Year | Joey de Leon | |- !scope="row" | 2015 | Child Star of the Year | Ryzza Mae Dizon | | style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row" rowspan="4"| 2016 | Newsmaker of the Year | Alden Richards and Maine Mendoza | |style="text- align:center;" rowspan="3"| |- | Celebrity Pair of the Year | Alden Richards and Maine Mendoza | |- | Child Star of the Year | Sebastian "Baste" Benedict | |- | Child Star of the Year | Ryzza Mae Dizon | | style="text-align:center;"| |} ==Platinum Stallion Media Awards== The Platinum Stallion Media Awards is an award-giving body of the Trinity University of Asia to honor the academe's choices for the year's best and brightest in television, radio, and print media. Eat Bulaga! won twice as the Best Noontime Show and received a citation as the Best Entertainment Program. The comic troika of Jose Manalo, Wally Bayola, and Paolo Ballesteros also received a special recognition for their roles in the segment Kalyeserye. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row"| 2015 | Best Noontime Show | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row" rowspan="2"| 2016 | Best Noontime Show | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2"| |- | Trinitian Awardee for Values-Oriented TV Character | Kalye's Angels (Jose Manalo, Wally Bayola, and Paolo Ballesteros) of Kalyeserye | |- !scope="row"| 2017 | Citation for Best Entertainment Program | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text- align:center;"| |- !scope= "row"| 2018 | Best Noontime Show | Eat Bulaga! | | |} ==PMPC Star Awards for Television== Founded by the Philippine Movie Press Club in 1987, the PMPC Star Awards for Television is a major award-giving body that recognizes the outstanding programming produced by the several television networks in the Philippines. After winning fifteen times as the Best Variety Show, Eat Bulaga! was finally inducted into the Hall of Fame in 2009. Its Hall of Fame status makes Eat Bulaga! ineligible to be nominated in the same category again. Its hosts have also been nominated in numerous different categories. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row" | 1987 | Best Variety Show | Eat Bulaga! | |style="text-align:center;" rowspan="11" | |- !scope="row" | 1990 | Best Male TV Host | Vic Sotto | |- !scope="row" | 1991 | Best New TV Personality | Christine Jacob | |- !scope="row" rowspan="2"| 1995 | Best Variety Show | Eat Bulaga! Richards | |- |Best Male TV Host |Vic Sotto | |- | colspan="6" | Notes: * — Tied with Wowowee. * — Tied with Arjo Atayde for "Dos Por Dos" episode of Maalaala Mo Kaya * — Tied with Simon "Onyok" Pineda * — Tied with John Estrada for "Mansanas at Juice" episode of Maalaala Mo Kaya |- |} ==Reader's Digest Trusted Brands Awards== The Trusted Brands Awards is a biennial awards ceremony presented by Reader's Digest Asia based on a survey conducted with thousands of consumers across seven markets in Asia to provide a credible source of review on the most trusted brands in the region. Vic Sotto and Ryan Agoncillo were named as one of the most trusted personalities for their contributions in the Philippine entertainment industry. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row"| 2013 | Most Trusted Entertainment/Variety Show Presenter | Vic Sotto | | style="text- align:center;"| |- !scope="row"| 2015 | Most Trusted Entertainment/Variety Show Presenter | Vic Sotto | | style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row"| 2017 | Most Trusted Entertainment/Variety Show Presenter | Ryan Agoncillo | | style="text-align:center;"| |} ==Tatt Awards== Globe Telecom's Tatt Awards celebrates the ten individuals, groups, or communities who have made a great impact in social media with their brand of content. The awardees, known as "The Great Ten," are distinguished for their positive acts, ideas, talents, or movements that achieved greatness by choosing to connect online. Eat Bulaga! and Paolo Ballesteros were included in the list for their heavy presence in social media during the peak of the AlDub phenomenon. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- ! rowspan="2" scope="row" | 2015 | The Great Ten | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;"| |- | The Great Ten | Paolo Ballesteros | | style="text-align:center;"| |- |} ==UmalohokJuan Awards== The annual UmalohokJuan Awards is organized by the Lyceum of the Philippines to recognize media entities and personalities that epitomize excellence in the field of television and radio broadcasting, print, advertising, and public relations. Eat Bulaga! and its host Vic Sotto have received two awards. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row" rowspan="2"| 2014 | Best Entertainment Program | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text- align:center;" rowspan="2"| |- | Best Male TV Personality | Vic Sotto | |- !scope="row" rowspan="2"| 2017 | Variety Show of the Year | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2"| |} ==USTv Students' Choice Awards == Born in 2005, the USTv Students' Choice Awards is a yearly awarding ceremony hosted by the University of Santo Tomas that recognizes excellence and Christian values in local television programs and personalities. Awards are based on students' preferences survey that accounts for Catholic and humanist values. Eat Bulaga! was chosen as the best variety show numerous times and the best television show of the year once. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row"| 2006 | Students' Choice of Variety Show | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row"|2012 | Students Choice of Variety Show | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row"|2013 | Student Leaders' Choice of TV Program | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row"|2014 | Students' Choice of Variety Show | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2"| |- !scope="row"|2015 | Students' Choice of Variety Show | Eat Bulaga! | |- !scope="row" rowspan=5"|2016 | Students' Choice of Variety Show | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="3"| |- | Special Recognition for Social Media Phenomenon | Alden Richards and Maine Mendoza | |- | Special Recognition for Social Media Phenomenon | Jose Manalo, Wally Bayola, and Paolo Ballesteros (Kalye's Angels) | |- | Students' Choice of Variety Show Host | Alden Richards | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2"| |- | Students' Choice of Variety Show Host | Ryan Agoncillo | |} ==Yahoo! Celebrity Awards== Yahoo! Celebrity Awards (formerly Yahoo! OMG Awards) is an awards ceremony presented by Yahoo! Philippines that honors the most popular personalities and programs across television, movies, music, social media, and sports. The nominees are voted into the top ranks by their fans across the world. Eat Bulaga! has won three awards from fourteen nominations. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:47%;"| Category ! scope="col" style="width:48%;"| Nominated artist/work ! scope="col" style="width:6%;"| Result ! scope="col" style="width:0.5%;"| |- !scope="row" rowspan="2"| 2011 | Favorite Male TV Host | Vic Sotto | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2"| |- | Favorite Female TV Host | Pia Guanio | |- !scope="row" rowspan="4"| 2012 | Favorite Male TV Host | Vic Sotto | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="4"| |- | Favorite Male TV Host | Ryan Agoncillo | |- | Favorite Female TV Host | Pia Guanio | |- | Favorite Female TV Host | Pauleen Luna | |- !scope="row" rowspan="4"| 2013 | Noontime Show of the Year | Eat Bulaga! | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="3"| |- | Child Star of the Year | Ryzza Mae Dizon | |- | Favorite Male TV Host | Vic Sotto | |- | Favorite Male TV Host | Ryan Agoncillo | | style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row" rowspan="4"| 2014 | Child Star of the Year | Ryzza Mae Dizon | | style="text- align:center;" rowspan="4"| |- | Favorite Male TV Host | Vic Sotto | |- | Favorite Male TV Host | Jose Manalo | |- | Favorite Female TV Host | Pauleen Luna | |} == Summary == Here is the summary of awards and nominations received by Eat Bulaga! as of June 6, 2019. {| class="wikitable" !Awards !Nominations !Wins |- |Aliw Awards |8 |1 |- |Anak TV Seal Awards |16 |16 |- |Asian Television Awards |1 |1 |- |Box Office Entertainment Awards |22 |22 |- |Catholic Social Media Awards |5 |5 |- |Eastwood City Walk of Fame |12 |12 |- |EdukCircle Awards |2 |2 |- |Face of Advertising and Marketing Excellence (FAME) Awards |2 |2 |- |FAMAS Awards |1 |1 |- |Filipino Franchise Show |1 |1 |- |Gawad Tanglaw Awards |5 |5 |- |GEMS Hiyas ng Sining Awards |1 |1 |- |Gintong Kabataan Awards |1 |1 |- |Global Pinoy Awards |1 |1 |- |Golden Screen TV Awards |25 |14 |- |Illumine |5 |5 |- |Inding-Indie Short Film Festival Awards |2 |2 |- |Kagitingan Awards for Television |8 |8 |- |Mabini Media Awards |2 |1 |- |Nickelodeon Kids' Choice Awards |1 |1 |- |Northwest Samar State University Students' Choice Awards for Radio and Television |16 |16 |- |OFW Gawad Parangal |3 |3 |- |Paragala Central Luzon Media Awards |2 |2 |- |Party Pilipinas Most Liked Awards |1 |1 |- |People's Choice Awards |3 |3 |- |PEP List Awards |23 |14 |- |Platinum Stallion Media Awards |5 |5 |- |PMPC Star Awards for Television |86 |37 |- |Reader's Digest Trusted Brands Awards |3 |3 |- |Tatt Awards |2 |2 |- |UmalohokJuan Awards |3 |3 |- |USTv Students' Choice Awards |10 |6 |- |Yahoo! Celebrity Awards |14 |3 |- !TOTAL !292 !200 |} ==References== ==External links== *Awards for Eat Bulaga! at Internet Movie Database Category:Eat Bulaga! Eat Bulaga!
title: List of accolades received by Eat Bulaga!
